alert.note: Alert for Cattaraugus; Chautauqua (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms with torrential rainfall will impact portions of west central Cattaraugus and east central Chautauqua Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 309 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sinclairville to western Little Valley. Very heavy rainfall is occurring with these storms. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Albion, Gerry, Conewango, Ellington, Leon, Napoli, Little Valley, East Otto, Cattaraugus, Otto, Cassadaga, South Dayton, East Randolph, Sinclairville, Cherry Creek, Bemus Point, Hamlet, Ellery Center and Cattaraugus County Landfill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
